page.title: 01LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS 1 APART FROM ISOLATED FARMSTEADS AND A HOLIDAY CAMP ON THE VILLAGE EDGE NORTH SOMERCOTES IS THE ONLY SETTLEMENT IN THE BLOCK.THE VILLAGE STANDS ON THE LINCOLNSHIRE MARSHES WHICH FORM A LITTORAL STRIP OF VARYING WIDTH FROM THE VICINITY OF SKEGNESS ROUND INTO THE HUMBER. THE LINCS MARSHES HAVE TWO SECTIONS - THE OUTMARSH WHICH IS FLAT MARINE CLAYS INTERRUPTED BY LOW HILLOCKS WHICH MAY BE VARIOUSLY, ANCIENT SAND DUNES, OUTCROPS OF THE UNDERLYING BOULDER CLAY,OR SPOIL HEAPS LEFT BY MEDIEVAL SALTMAKERS. ESSENTIALLY THOUGH THE OUTMARSH IS FLAT. THE SECOND SECTION IS THE MIDDLE MARSH WHICH LIES BETWEEN THE OUTMARSH AND THE WOLDS.THIS SUB-REGION IS UNDULATING AND IS MORAINIC IN ORIGIN I.E.GLACIAL TILL WITH SOME PATCHES OF GRAVEL.
